intro: Sauvetrea cornuta, commonly known as the horned sauvetrea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky bracts that resemble horns, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
